"Is short stature, hyperextensibility, hernia, ocular depression, Rieger anomaly, and teething delay inherited ?","SHORT syndrome has an autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance, which means one copy of the altered PIK3R1 gene in each cell is sufficient to cause the disorder. In most cases, the condition results from a new mutation in the gene and occurs in people with no history of the disorder in their family.
